column4: hey all... any screen users in here?  Does anyone know why screen -ls might list a bunch of screens I'm attached to, but I can't actually switch to any of them?
ctrl-a n to switch to the next
Ah.. how do I change the screen instance then?
Boon: you mean screen -r ?  it lists a bunch of attached screens and says there is no screen to be resumed
it will force disconnect the screen if it is currently connected
if you are in a screen press ctrl+a then shift+"
no -R is like a more powerfull -r if i remember right
but like mentioned are you in screen trying to do that?
yea they are attached so I would just exit out as much as you can the start fresh with a screen -R
the screen -R will detach it and allow you to connect
sure there is, but depends on what your doing
for example i used to run a headless torrent box, and ssh was my means of access. I would load a torrent on each screen to be able to quickly connect and see them.
with a gui it is pointless
with a gui i can only see needing that to launch an app or script and leave it in the background and logout
that way you could come back later screen back in and be back where you left off.
